title: 109_hr4739
content: The Act is titled the "Civilian Agent Orange Act of 2006" and includes definitions. The "Civilian Agent Orange Act of 2006" defines an "exposed employee" as an individual who was a civilian employee of the Federal Government or a contractor of the Department of Defense during the Vietnam conflict. The individual must have been physically present in the Republic of Vietnam between January 9, 1962, and May 7, 1975, or in or near the Korean demilitarized zone between September 1, 1967, and the end of the conflict. The "Civilian Agent Orange Act of 2006" defines an "exposed employee" as someone who was present in Vietnam or near the Korean demilitarized zone during specific timeframes. An "Agent Orange illness" is a condition associated with certain chemicals used during the Vietnam conflict. The "Agent Orange Illness Compensation Program" is established by the Civilian Agent Orange Act of 2006 to provide timely and adequate compensation for exposed employees and their survivors suffering from Agent Orange illnesses. The program is overseen by the Attorney General and aims to address conditions associated with chemicals used during the Vietnam conflict. The "Agent Orange Illness Compensation Fund" is established to provide compensation for those affected by Agent Orange. The fund consists of appropriated and transferred amounts, with additional funding from the Treasury if needed. The funds are used to carry out the compensation program, with administrative costs not paid from the fund. (e) Administrative Costs not Paid From Fund. No cost incurred in carrying out the compensation program or administering the fund shall be paid from the compensation fund. (f) Monetary Allowance not to Be Considered as Income or Resources. A monetary allowance paid under this Act shall not be considered as income or resources for determining eligibility for federal programs. (g) Investment. Amounts in the fund shall be invested in accordance with title 31, with interest and proceeds credited to the fund. (h) Authorization of Appropriations. $100,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated to the fund. SEC. 5. COMPENSATION TO BE PROVIDED. An exposed employee or their eligible survivor shall receive $100,000 in compensation for injury, illness, or death related to Agent Orange exposure. If the employee is deceased, payment will go to the surviving spouse. If the exposed employee dies, $100,000 in compensation will be paid to the surviving spouse or equally among all children under 18 living at the time of payment. If the employee dies before filing a claim, a survivor can file for the payment. The definition of "spouse" includes a husband or wife of the individual. Children with spina bifida born to exposed employees due to Agent Orange exposure are eligible for compensation determined under subsection (b). SEC. 6. CLAIMS PROCESSING. The Attorney General sets standards for filing and processing claims, with a 20-year deadline for filing. Payment requires written medical evidence deemed adequate. Claims are not subject to review. SEC. 7. IMPLEMENTATION. The Attorney General will create regulations for implementing the Act. SEC. 8. OFFSET FOR CERTAIN OTHER PAYMENTS. SEC. 8. OFFSET FOR CERTAIN OTHER PAYMENTS. Compensation under this Act will be reduced by any payments received from a final award or settlement related to the same illness, injury, or death caused by exposure to Agent Orange herbicides.
